pull.title: 3 more security enhancements
pull.body: Please see the detailed description in the commits below.

verification.payload:
tree 067219dcf3d80504e84e78f731550a1a9d4018f3
parent 2f7d9aec4d049701fccfc029f44934d187467432
author buerbaumer <44548809+buerbaumer@users.noreply.github.com> 1723736197 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1723736197 +0200

Update SECURITY.md

Necessity: When reporting security vulnerabilities, especially for a project related to cryptocurrency like Bitcoin, it's crucial to ensure that the information is transmitted securely. If an email containing a vulnerability is intercepted in transit, it could lead to exploitation before the developers can patch the issue.

Correctness: Instructing users to encrypt their emails using PGP is a standard practice in security-conscious projects. This recommendation aligns with best practices and provides an additional layer of security.

Impact: This enhancement would improve the security of vulnerability reports. Users who are not familiar with PGP may find it slightly more challenging, but the benefit of protecting sensitive information outweighs this inconvenience.

events.message:

If an email containing a vulnerability is intercepted in transit, it could lead to exploitation before the developers can patch the issue.

verification.payload:
tree de63213323b3eb7b31acee0e3339fa5138d5e170
parent e34983deda1706026715bf9ff8eb6cb976f6f458
author buerbaumer <44548809+buerbaumer@users.noreply.github.com> 1723736381 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1723736381 +0200

Update autogen.sh

Necessity: The set -euo pipefail command in shell scripts ensures that the script exits immediately if a command fails (-e), an undefined variable is used (-u), or if any command in a pipeline fails (pipefail). This is a critical security measure to ensure that the script doesn't continue executing if something goes wrong, which could potentially lead to unexpected behavior or security issues.

Correctness: Using set -euo pipefail is a best practice for writing robust and secure shell scripts. This command is correctly implemented and improves the overall safety of the script.

Impact: This change ensures the script behaves more predictably and securely, reducing the risk of errors and undefined behaviors. The only impact is that it might cause the script to terminate earlier than expected in case of errors, but this is desirable in most cases to prevent unintended consequences.

tree 7062b5be65d20acd675c2632fffe148d628c377b
parent 5343083b661f065d139cdf1756aedfdcb3d3c34f
author buerbaumer <44548809+buerbaumer@users.noreply.github.com> 1723737493 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1723737493 +0200

Update psbt.cpp

Problem: The function PrecomputePSBTData might dereference psbtx.tx if it's null, which would lead to undefined behavior.

Proposed Fix: The fix checks if psbtx.tx is null before proceeding with the computation, preventing a potential null pointer dereference.

events.message:

verification.payload:
tree 2dd12857072bc0d5ddc0f00d24752ca8b8877804
parent 72cf4e0bf5e561840e5b04a0a82272800cc195dd
author buerbaumer <44548809+buerbaumer@users.noreply.github.com> 1723737647 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1723737647 +0200

Update psbt.cpp

Problem: If in_amt is less than out_amt, the fee would be negative, which is invalid.

Proposed Fix: The fix ensures that in_amt is not less than out_amt before calculating the fee, thereby preventing an invalid negative fee.

author buerbaumer <44548809+buerbaumer@users.noreply.github.com> 1723737895 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1723737895 +0200

Update txreconciliation.cpp

Problem: Uninitialized variables can lead to undefined behavior if accessed before being set.

Proposed Fix: The fix initializes the variables with default values, preventing any potential issues with uninitialized data.

Make sure to run all tests locally, according to the documentation.

The failure may happen due to a number of reasons, for example:

* Possibly due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the
  affected test.

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

</details>

Thanks for your interest in contributing. Please see the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Pull requests should be focused (there seem to be 4-5 changes here that don't relate to one another) and provide rationale in the commit messages. Also, please do not open duplicate pull requests.

Closing this due to lack of conceptual support.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 
 export LC_ALL=C
-set -e
+set -euo pipefail
comments.body:
Please see my previous reply (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30662#issuecomment-2291573530)

The file will be deleted soon. Applying minor cosmetic changes or unspecified "hardening" to a file that will be deleted is pointless.

Only severe bugs can be fixed at this point. However, you will have to explain the bug and add exact steps to reproduce.

This is a wrong change.

It's perfectly valid to have a PSBT with a "negative fee", -- as it may not yet have sufficient inputs to add up to the outputs.  The code as is works correctly in this respect.
can you reproduce this with a test? If so, please add it so that we can validate that this is a valid concern and not just the result of a static analysis tool.

Unnecessarily initialization can create performance problems when they happen on tight inner-loop code (though I didn't check if they do in this case).

More importantly, they can conceal serious flaws when something that must be initialized like a random seed is instead used with an unacceptable static initial value.  Without the unnecessary initialization valgrind/msan will find these errors, but with it they won't.

In some cases it's possible to default initialize a value to a "safe value"-- such as NULL for a pointer.  In which case, one could argue that the safety of the safe value offsets the loss of valgrind sensitivity (one can also do things like use the valgrind macros to initialize but still mark the memory as uninitialized to have your cake and eat it too).  ... but this doesn't apply for things like randomness salt.

This is true, but in this case actually irrelevant. Since every constructor of the class initializes all the fields, the change here literally has no effect; the initializers for fields are just defaults that get used when a constructor doesn't contain an explicit initialization.
